title: Personal Data Privacy Breach and Protection
description: When your personal data is misused, leaked, or collected without consent by companies or websites, you have rights under data protection laws.

rights.title: Right to Data Protection and Privacy
rights.description: Fundamental right to privacy includes protection of personal data from unauthorized access and misuse.
rights.application: All individuals have right to control how their personal data is collected, processed, and stored by organizations.
limitations: Comprehensive data protection law still being implemented

rights.title: Right to Informed Consent for Data Collection
rights.description: Organizations must obtain clear, informed consent before collecting or processing personal data.
rights.application: Companies must inform users about data collection purposes and obtain explicit consent.
examples: App permissions for accessing device data
Terms of service must be clear about data use

actionSteps.title: Document the Privacy Breach
actionSteps.description: Gather evidence of how your data was compromised, including screenshots, emails, or notifications.

actionSteps.title: Report to the Organization
actionSteps.description: Contact the company's data protection officer or customer service about the breach.
tips: Ask what steps they're taking to prevent recurrence
Request deletion of your data if desired

actionSteps.title: File Complaint with CERT-In
actionSteps.description: Report cyber security incidents including data breaches to Computer Emergency Response Team.

actionSteps.title: Approach Consumer Court for Compensation
actionSteps.description: File complaint in consumer court if you suffered financial loss due to data breach negligence.

timeSensitivity.description: Data breaches should be reported promptly to minimize damage and preserve evidence
